title: 93/304/EEC: Commission Decision of 18 December 1991 on the establishment of the Community support framework for Community structural assistance in the areas eligible under Objective 2 in the province of Turnhout (Belgium) (Only the French and Dutch texts are authentic)
header:
<{COM}>COMMISSION DECISION of 18 December 1991 on the establishment of the Community support framework for Community structural assistance in the areas eligible under Objective 2 in the province of Turnhout (Belgium) (Only the French and Dutch  texts are authentic)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The Commission support framework for Community structural assistance in the areas eligible under Objective 2 in Turnhout covering the period from 1 January 1992 to 31 December 1993, is hereby approved.
The Commission declares that it intends to contribute to the implementation of this Community support framework in accordance with the detailed provisions thereof and in compliance with the rules and guidelines governing the Structural Funds and the  other existing financial instruments.

The Community support framework contains the following essential information:
(a) the priorities for joint action:
- industrial development, diversification and renewal,
- promotion and improvement of tourist potential,
- expansion of applied scientific research,
- extension of industrial estates and improvement of the environment;
(b) an outline of the forms of assistance to be provided (mainly operational programmes);
(c) an indicative financing plan specifying, at constant 1992 prices, the total cost of the priorities selected for joint action by the Community and the Member State (ECU 116,05 million over the whole period) and the total amount of the expected  contribution from the Community budget for national initiatives and Community programmes, broken down as follows:
ERDF ECU 11,84 million
ESF ECU 2,6 million
Total for Structural Funds ECU 14,44 million.
The resultant national financing required (some ECU 19,88 million from the public sector and ECU 0,2 million from the private sector) may be partially covered by Community loans from the European Investment Bank and the other lending instruments.
This Declaration of Intent is addressed to the Kingdom of Belgium.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 18 December 1991.
For the Commission
Bruce MILLAN
Member of the Commission
